IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO FACILITATE THE LONG TERM SUCCESS OF MANUFACTURERS IN NEW YORK STATE. THE ASSOCIATION ADVOCATES A FAVORABLE BUSINESS CLIMATE IN NEW YORK STATE AND PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE SUCCESS OF ITS MEMBERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO FACILITATE THE LONG TERM SUCCESS OF MANUFACTURERS IN NEW YORK STATE. THE ASSOCIATION ADVOCATES A FAVORABLE BUSINESS CLIMATE IN NEW YORK STATE AND PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE SUCCESS OF ITS MEMBERS.
IRS990.Desc: THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDES AN ONGOING SOURCE OF INFORMATION FOR 310+ MEMBERS REPRESENTING THOUSANDS OF EMPLOYEES. THIS INCLUDES TRAINING CONSULTING; HUMAN RESOURCE CONSULTING; CONSORTIUMS AND ADVOCACY IN GOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS. THE ASSOCIATION ADVOCATES FOR A FAVORABLE BUSINESS CLIMATE IN NEW YORK STATE AND PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE SUCCESS OF ITS MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS INCLUDE MANUFACTURING COMPANIES ALONG WITH VARIOUS OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVICE THAT INDUSTRY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RETURN IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE ORGANIZATION AND IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL AUDIT COMMITTEE MEMBERS FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING. COPIES ARE PROVIDED TO REMAINING BOARD MEMBERS UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS. THE POLICY IS MONITORED AS WARRANTED IF CONFLICTS ARISE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 1. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD REVIEWS THE CEO'S ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND GOALS ATTAINED. 2. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD RECOMMENDS TO THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION. 3. THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVES THE COMPENSATION.
